intro: Lomaria lanuginosa, commonly known as the downy lomaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a soft, downy appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions in Europe and Asia, often found in grassy habitats and disturbed soils. Lomaria lanuginosa is generally a short-lived perennial, growing to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters.
